Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.game

Class NetMap

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.game.NetMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class NetMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
This is the network class that represent the server game map, it is a fully map with all the needed information using other network classes like NetCell directly and indirectly through the previous cited: NetWorker, NetBuilding.
See Also:
Serialized Form

      public NetMap​(Map map)
      Creates a map from a Cell copying it in the network version.

    • NetMap

      private NetMap​(NetMap netMap, NetCell cell, int x, int y)
      Modifies a network map changing a cell on it, without modifying other values.
      Parameters:
      netMap - the network map to modify
      cell - cell to insert
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordinate

  • Method Details

    • changeCell

      public NetMap changeCell​(NetCell newCell, int x, int y)
      Changes the current map changin a cell in the specified cartesian coordinates.
      Parameters:
      newCell - the new cell to insert in the map
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordinate
      Returns:
      the new modified map

    • getCell

      public NetCell getCell​(int x, int y) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      It gets a cell of the current map given some cartesian coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordinate
      Returns:
      the NetCell at the given coordinates
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the coordinates aren't inside the map

    • getX

      public int getX​(NetCell c) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Gets the x cartesian coordinate of a given cell of the map.
      Parameters:
      c - is the cell to search for
      Returns:
      an integer representing its x coordinate
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the NetCell doesn't exists

    • getY

      public int getY​(NetCell c) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Gets the y cartesian coordinate of a given cell of the map.
      Parameters:
      c - is the cell to search for
      Returns:
      an integer representing its y coordinate
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the NetCell doesn't exists

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(NetCell cell)
      Checks if the given cell is inside the current map.
      Parameters:
      cell - a NetCell
      Returns:
      true if the cell is contained, false instead
